ayas.translation: By those who range themselves in ranks,
And so are strong in repelling (evil),
And thus proclaim the Message (of Allah)!
Verily, verily, your Allah is one!-

ayas.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلْمَشَـٰرِقِ
ayas.translation: Lord of the heavens and of the earth and all between them, and Lord of every point at the rising of the sun!
ayas.transliteration: rabbus samāwāti wal-arḍi wa mā baynahumā warabbul mashāriq

ayas.arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنْيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلْكَوَاكِبِ
ayas.translation: We have indeed decked the lower heaven with beauty (in) the stars,-
(For beauty) and for guard against all obstinate rebellious evil spirits,

ayas.arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلْمَلَإِ ٱلْأَعْلَىٰ وَيُقْذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٍ
ayas.translation: (So) they should not strain their ears in the direction of the Exalted Assembly but be cast away from every side,
ayas.transliteration: lā yassamma`ūna ilal-mala-il-a`lā wayuqdhafūna min kulli jānib

ayas.translation: Repulsed, for they are under a perpetual penalty,

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ خَطِفَ ٱلْخَطْفَةَ فَأَتْبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٌ ثَاقِبٌ
ayas.translation: Except such as snatch away something by stealth, and they are pursued by a flaming fire, of piercing brightness.
ayas.transliteration: illā man khaṭifal khaṭfata fa-atba`ahu shihābun thāqib

ayas.arabic: فَٱسْتَفْتِهِمْ أَهُمْ أَشَدُّ خَلْقًا أَم مَّنْ خَلَقْنَآ ۚ إِنَّا خَلَقْنَـٰهُم مِّن طِينٍ لَّازِبٍۭ
ayas.translation: Just ask their opinion: are they the more difficult to create, or the (other) beings We have created? Them have We created out of a sticky clay!
ayas.transliteration: fastaftihim ahum ashaddu khalqan am man khalaqnā ۚ innā khalaqnāhum min ṭīnin lāzib

ayas.translation: Truly dost thou marvel, while they ridicule,
And, when they are admonished, pay no heed,-
And, when they see a Sign, turn it to mockery,

ayas.arabic: وَقَالُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayas.translation: And say, "This is nothing but evident sorcery!
ayas.transliteration: waqālū in hādhā illā siḥrun mubīn

ayas.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
ayas.translation: "What! when we die, and become dust and bones, shall we (then) be raised up (again)
ayas.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamab`ūthūn

ayas.translation: "And also our fathers of old?"
Say thou: "Yea, and ye shall then be humiliated (on account of your evil)."

ayas.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِىَ زَجْرَةٌ وَٰحِدَةٌ فَإِذَا هُمْ يَنظُرُونَ
ayas.translation: Then it will be a single (compelling) cry; and behold, they will begin to see!
ayas.transliteration: fa-innamā hiya zajratun wāḥidatun fa-idhā hum yanẓurūn

ayas.translation: They will say, "Ah! Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"

ayas.arabic: هَـٰذَا يَوْمُ ٱلْفَصْلِ ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
ayas.translation: (A voice will say,) "This is the Day of Sorting Out, whose truth ye (once) denied!"
ayas.transliteration: hādhā yawmul faṣlil ladhī kuntum bihi tukadhhibūn

ayas.arabic: ٱحْشُرُوا۟ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا۟ وَأَزْوَٰجَهُمْ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْبُدُونَ
ayas.translation: "Bring ye up", it shall be said, "The wrong-doers and their wives, and the things they worshipped-
ayas.transliteration: uḥ-shurul ladhīna ẓalamū wa-azwājahum wa mā kānū ya`budūn

ayas.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهْدُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayas.translation: "Besides Allah, and lead them to the Way to the (Fierce) Fire!
ayas.transliteration: min dūnillāhi fahdūhum ilā ṣirāṭil jaḥīm

ayas.translation: "But stop them, for they must be asked:
"'What is the matter with you that ye help not each other?'"
Nay, but that day they shall submit (to Judgment);
And they will turn to one another, and question one another.

ayas.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّكُمْ كُنتُمْ تَأْتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayas.translation: They will say: "It was ye who used to come to us from the right hand (of power and authority)!"
They will reply: "Nay, ye yourselves had no Faith!

ayas.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيْكُم مِّن سُلْطَـٰنٍۭ ۖ بَلْ كُنتُمْ قَوْمًا طَـٰغِينَ
ayas.translation: "Nor had we any authority over you. Nay, it was ye who were a people in obstinate rebellion!
ayas.transliteration: wa mā kāna lanā `alaykum min sulṭān ۖ bal kuntum qawman ṭāghīn

ayas.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيْنَا قَوْلُ رَبِّنَآ ۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ
ayas.translation: "So now has been proved true, against us, the word of our Lord that we shall indeed (have to) taste (the punishment of our sins).
"We led you astray: for truly we were ourselves astray."
Truly, that Day, they will (all) share in the Penalty.
Verily that is how We shall deal with Sinners.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوٓا۟ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
ayas.translation: For they, when they were told that there is no god except Allah, would puff themselves up with Pride,
ayas.transliteration: innahum kānū idhā qīla lahum lā ilāha illallāhu yastakbirūn

ayas.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓا۟ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٍ مَّجْنُونٍۭ
ayas.translation: And say: "What! shall we give up our gods for the sake of a Poet possessed?"
ayas.transliteration: wayaqūlūna a-innā latārikū ālihatinā lishā`irin majnūn

ayas.translation: Nay! he has come with the (very) Truth, and he confirms (the Message of) the messengers (before him).
ayas.transliteration: bal jā-a bil ḥaqqi waṣaddaqal mursalīn

ayas.translation: Ye shall indeed taste of the Grievous Penalty;-

ayas.arabic: وَمَا تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: But it will be no more than the retribution of (the Evil) that ye have wrought;-
ayas.transliteration: wa mā tujzawna illā mā kuntum ta`malūn

ayas.translation: But the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah,-
For them is a Sustenance determined,
Fruits (Delights); and they (shall enjoy) honour and dignity,
In Gardens of Felicity,
Facing each other on Thrones (of Dignity):
Round will be passed to them a Cup from a clear-flowing fountain,
Crystal-white, of a taste delicious to those who drink (thereof),

ayas.arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوْلٌ وَلَا هُمْ عَنْهَا يُنزَفُونَ
ayas.translation: Free from headiness; nor will they suffer intoxication therefrom.
ayas.transliteration: lā fīhā ghawlun walā hum `anhā yunzafūn

ayas.translation: And besides them will be chaste women, restraining their glances, with big eyes (of wonder and beauty).
As if they were (delicate) eggs closely guarded.
Then they will turn to one another and question one another.

ayas.arabic: قَالَ قَآئِلٌ مِّنْهُمْ إِنِّى كَانَ لِى قَرِينٌ
ayas.translation: One of them will start the talk and say: "I had an intimate companion (on the earth),
ayas.transliteration: qāla qā-ilun minhum innī kāna lī qarīn

ayas.translation: "Who used to say, 'what! art thou amongst those who bear witness to the Truth (of the Message)?

ayas.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ
ayas.translation: "'When we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed receive rewards and punishments?'"
ayas.transliteration: a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamadīnūn

ayas.translation: (A voice) said: "Would ye like to look down?"
He looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire.
He said: "By Allah! thou wast little short of bringing me to perdition!

ayas.arabic: وَلَوْلَا نِعْمَةُ رَبِّى لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلْمُحْضَرِينَ
ayas.translation: "Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I should certainly have been among those brought (there)!
ayas.transliteration: walawlā ni`matu rabbī lakuntu minal muḥḍarīn

ayas.translation: "Is it (the case) that we shall not die,

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلْأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
ayas.translation: "Except our first death, and that we shall not be punished?"
ayas.transliteration: illā mawtatanal-ūlā wa mā naḥnu bimu`adhhabīn

ayas.translation: Verily this is the supreme achievement!
For the like of this let all strive, who wish to strive.

ayas.arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ نُّزُلًا أَمْ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ
ayas.translation: Is that the better entertainment or the Tree of Zaqqum?
ayas.transliteration: adhālika khayrun nuzulan am shajaratuz zaqqūm

ayas.translation: For We have truly made it (as) a trial for the wrong-doers.

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٌ تَخْرُجُ فِىٓ أَصْلِ ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayas.translation: For it is a tree that springs out of the bottom of Hell-Fire:
ayas.transliteration: innahā shajaratun takhruju fī aṣlil jaḥīm

ayas.translation: The shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of devils:

ayas.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ لَـَٔاكِلُونَ مِنْهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنْهَا ٱلْبُطُونَ
ayas.translation: Truly they will eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.
ayas.transliteration: fa-innahum la-ākilūna minhā famāli-ūna minhal buṭūn

ayas.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمْ عَلَيْهَا لَشَوْبًا مِّنْ حَمِيمٍ
ayas.translation: Then on top of that they will be given a mixture made of boiling water.
ayas.transliteration: thumma inna lahum `alayhā lashawban min ḥamīm

ayas.translation: Then shall their return be to the (Blazing) Fire.
Truly they found their fathers on the wrong Path;
So they (too) were rushed down on their footsteps!
And truly before them, many of the ancients went astray;-
But We sent aforetime, among them, (messengers) to admonish them;-
Then see what was the end of those who were admonished (but heeded not),-
Except the sincere (and devoted) Servants of Allah.
(In the days of old), Noah cried to Us, and We are the best to hear prayer.
And We delivered him and his people from the Great Calamity,
And made his progeny to endure (on this earth);
And We left (this blessing) for him among generations to come in later times:
"Peace and salutation to Noah among the nations!"
Thus indeed do we reward those who do right.
For he was one of our believing Servants.
Then the rest we overwhelmed in the Flood.
Verily among those who followed his Way was Abraham.
Behold! he approached his Lord with a sound heart.

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعْبُدُونَ
ayas.translation: Behold! he said to his father and to his people, "What is that which ye worship?
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla li-abīhi waqawmihi mādhā ta`budūn

ayas.translation: "Is it a falsehood- gods other than Allah- that ye desire?
"Then what is your idea about the Lord of the worlds?"
Then did he cast a glance at the Stars.
And he said, "I am indeed sick (at heart)!"
So they turned away from him, and departed.

ayas.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمْ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
ayas.translation: Then did he turn to their gods and said, "will ye not eat (of the offerings before you)?...
ayas.transliteration: farāgha ilā ālihatihim faqāla alā ta-kulūn

ayas.translation: "What is the matter with you that ye speak not (intelligently)?"
Then did he turn upon them, striking (them) with the right hand.
Then came (the worshippers) with hurried steps, and faced (him).
He said: "Worship ye that which ye have (yourselves) carved?
"But Allah has created you and your handwork!"

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱبْنُوا۟ لَهُۥ بُنْيَـٰنًا فَأَلْقُوهُ فِى ٱلْجَحِيمِ
ayas.translation: They said, "Build him a furnace, and throw him into the blazing fire!"
ayas.transliteration: qālub-nū lahu bunyānan fa-alqūhu fil jaḥīm

ayas.translation: (This failing), they then sought a stratagem against him, but We made them the ones most humiliated!

ayas.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّى ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
ayas.translation: He said: "I will go to my Lord! He will surely guide me!
ayas.transliteration: waqāla innī dhāhibun ilā rabbī sayahdīn

ayas.translation: "O my Lord! Grant me a righteous (son)!"
So We gave him the good news of a boy ready to suffer and forbear.

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعْىَ قَالَ يَـٰبُنَىَّ إِنِّىٓ أَرَىٰ فِى ٱلْمَنَامِ أَنِّىٓ أَذْبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا تَرَىٰ ۚ قَالَ يَـٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفْعَلْ مَا تُؤْمَرُ ۖ سَتَجِدُنِىٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰبِرِينَ
ayas.translation: Then, when (the son) reached (the age of) (serious) work with him, he said: "O my son! I see in vision that I offer thee in sacrifice: Now see what is thy view!" (The son) said: "O my father! Do as thou art commanded: thou will find me, if Allah so wills one practising Patience and Constancy!"
ayas.transliteration: falammā balagha ma`ahus sa`ya qāla yābunayya innī arā fil manāmi annī adhbaḥuka fanẓur mādhā tarā ۚ qāla yā-abatif-`al mā tu-mar ۖ satajidunī in shā-allāhu minaṣ ṣābirīn

ayas.translation: So when they had both submitted their wills (to Allah), and he had laid him prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice),
We called out to him "O Abraham!

ayas.arabic: قَدْ صَدَّقْتَ ٱلرُّءْيَآ ۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
ayas.translation: "Thou hast already fulfilled the vision!" - thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
ayas.transliteration: qad ṣaddaqtar ru-yā ۚ innā kadhālika najzil muḥsinīn

ayas.translation: For this was obviously a trial-
And We ransomed him with a momentous sacrifice:
And We left (this blessing) for him among generations (to come) in later times:
"Peace and salutation to Abraham!"
Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
For he was one of our believing Servants.
And We gave him the good news of Isaac - a prophet,- one of the Righteous.

ayas.arabic: وَبَـٰرَكْنَا عَلَيْهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسْحَـٰقَ ۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحْسِنٌ وَظَالِمٌ لِّنَفْسِهِۦ مُبِينٌ
ayas.translation: We blessed him and Isaac: but of their progeny are (some) that do right, and (some) that obviously do wrong, to their own souls.
ayas.transliteration: wabāraknā `alayhi wa`alā is-ḥāq ۚ wa min dhurriyyatihimā muḥsinun waẓālimul linafsihi mubīn

ayas.translation: Again (of old) We bestowed Our favour on Moses and Aaron,
And We delivered them and their people from (their) Great Calamity;
And We helped them, so they overcame (their troubles);
And We gave them the Book which helps to make things clear;
And We guided them to the Straight Way.
And We left (this blessing) for them among generations (to come) in later times:
"Peace and salutation to Moses and Aaron!"
Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
For they were two of our believing Servants.
So also was Elias among those sent (by Us).
Behold, he said to his people, "Will ye not fear (Allah)?
"Will ye call upon Baal and forsake the Best of Creators,-
"Allah, your Lord and Cherisher and the Lord and Cherisher of your fathers of old?"
But they rejected him, and they will certainly be called up (for punishment),-
Except the sincere and devoted Servants of Allah (among them).
And We left (this blessing) for him among generations (to come) in later times:
"Peace and salutation to such as Elias!"
Thus indeed do We reward those who do right.
For he was one of our believing Servants.
So also was Lut among those sent (by Us).
Behold, We delivered him and his adherents, all
Except an old woman who was among those who lagged behind:
Then We destroyed the rest.
Verily, ye pass by their (sites), by day-
And by night: will ye not understand?
So also was Jonah among those sent (by Us).
When he ran away (like a slave from captivity) to the ship (fully) laden,
He (agreed to) cast lots, and he was condemned:
Then the big Fish did swallow him, and he had done acts worthy of blame.
Had it not been that he (repented and) glorified Allah,

ayas.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِى بَطْنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
ayas.translation: He would certainly have remained inside the Fish till the Day of Resurrection.
ayas.transliteration: lalabitha fī baṭnihi ilā yawmi yub`athūn

ayas.translation: But We cast him forth on the naked shore in a state of sickness,
And We caused to grow, over him, a spreading plant of the gourd kind.

ayas.arabic: وَأَرْسَلْنَـٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِا۟ئَةِ أَلْفٍ أَوْ يَزِيدُونَ
ayas.translation: And We sent him (on a mission) to a hundred thousand (men) or more.
ayas.transliteration: wa-arsalnāhu ilā mī-ati alfin aw yazīdūn

ayas.translation: And they believed; so We permitted them to enjoy (their life) for a while.
Now ask them their opinion: Is it that thy Lord has (only) daughters, and they have sons?-

ayas.arabic: أَمْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَـٰثًا وَهُمْ شَـٰهِدُونَ
ayas.translation: Or that We created the angels female, and they are witnesses (thereto)?
ayas.transliteration: am khalaqnal malā-ikata ināthan wahum shāhidūn

ayas.translation: Is it not that they say, from their own invention,
"Allah has begotten children"? but they are liars!
Did He (then) choose daughters rather than sons?
What is the matter with you? How judge ye?
Will ye not then receive admonition?
Or have ye an authority manifest?
Then bring ye your Book (of authority) if ye be truthful!

ayas.arabic: وَجَعَلُوا۟ بَيْنَهُۥ وَبَيْنَ ٱلْجِنَّةِ نَسَبًا ۚ وَلَقَدْ عَلِمَتِ ٱلْجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمْ لَمُحْضَرُونَ
ayas.translation: And they have invented a blood-relationship between Him and the Jinns: but the Jinns know (quite well) that they have indeed to appear (before his Judgment-Seat)!
ayas.transliteration: waja`alū baynahu wabaynal jinnati nasabā ۚ walaqad `alimatil jinnatu innahum lamuḥḍarūn

ayas.translation: Glory to Allah! (He is free) from the things they ascribe (to Him)!
Not (so do) the Servants of Allah, sincere and devoted.
For, verily, neither ye nor those ye worship-
Can lead (any) into temptation concerning Allah,
Except such as are (themselves) going to the blazing Fire!

ayas.arabic: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٌ مَّعْلُومٌ
ayas.translation: (Those ranged in ranks say): "Not one of us but has a place appointed;
ayas.transliteration: wa mā minnā illā lahu maqāmun ma`lūm

ayas.translation: "And we are verily ranged in ranks (for service);
"And we are verily those who declare (Allah's) glory!"
And there were those who said,

ayas.arabic: لَوْ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكْرًا مِّنَ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: "If only we had had before us a Message from those of old,
"We should certainly have been Servants of Allah, sincere (and devoted)!"
But (now that the Qur'an has come), they reject it: But soon will they know!
Already has Our Word been passed before (this) to our Servants sent (by Us),
That they would certainly be assisted,
And that Our forces,- they surely must conquer.
So turn thou away from them for a little while,
And watch them (how they fare), and they soon shall see (how thou farest)!
Do they wish (indeed) to hurry on our Punishment?

ayas.arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمْ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
ayas.translation: But when it descends into the open space before them, evil will be the morning for those who were warned (and heeded not)!
ayas.transliteration: fa-idhā nazala bisāḥatihim fasā-a ṣabāḥul mundharīn

ayas.translation: So turn thou away from them for a little while,
And watch (how they fare) and they soon shall see (how thou farest)!

ayas.arabic: سُبْحَـٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلْعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ
ayas.translation: Glory to thy Lord, the Lord of Honour and Power! (He is free) from what they ascribe (to Him)!
And Peace on the messengers!
And Praise to Allah, the Lord and Cherisher of the Worlds.
